titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Brown Letter, 1862 MS 199

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 19:08:00 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: This collection contains a letter written by John Brown to his wife. It was written from Grigsby's Bluff and gives news of the people there, in particular, their health. Grigsby's Bluff was located on the Neches River in Eastern Jefferson County. Its name was changed to Port Neches in 1901.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Nothing is known about the author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a letter written by John Brown to his wife. It was written from Grigsby's Bluff and gives news of the people there, in particular, their health. Grigsby's Bluff was located on the Neches River in Eastern Jefferson County. Its name was changed to Port Neches in 1901.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated to Fondren Library by Mrs. Halora Adams Burleson in May 1973.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: This collection is available online at: https://scholarship.rice.edu/handle/1911/21716

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Brown Letter, 1862, MS 199 Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the John Brown Letter must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.
